page.title: 19TOURISM
page.content: {Calderdale Way}leads through Soyland in the East of the block past Mill Bank village along to Lighthazels Road to the derelict Flint's Reservoir.The route climbs to {Crow Hill}with its wonderful panoramic views in different directions. The way slowly descends past Catherine House Farm to Cragg Vale.The {Moorland}attracts all kinds of people walkers,hikers,artists,poets historians,writers and photographers each evaluating the remote rugged beauty of the area and its variety of wild life.A{Conference Centre}is to be created at Cotton Stones Church. In Mill Bank a gentleman keeps longhorn cattle,a bird sanctuary,rare species of ducks and Jacob sheep.On Soyland slopes Highland cattle can be seen.At Flint Hill in Soyland a man keeps owls and kestrels which have been injured.
